title: How to Make and Use a Pumpkin in Minecraft

steps.title: Find a pumpkin.
steps.content: Find a pumpkin. Search a grassy biome (like a plains, extreme hills, or swamp biome) to find a pumpkin . They spawn on top of grass and are typically found in multiples. [1] X Research source Pumpkins can also spawn in snowy and sandy portions of the world, but this isn’t very common.

steps.title: Place the pumpkin down in front of you.
steps.content: Place the pumpkin down in front of you. Keep in mind that pumpkins can only be carved on the sides, not on the top. PC/Mac: Right-click Xbox: Hit LT PlayStation: Hit L2 Nintendo Switch: Hit ZL Mobile: Tap the screen

steps.title: Cut the pumpkin with shears to carve it.
steps.content: Cut the pumpkin with shears to carve it. Craft some shears with 2 iron ingots if you don’t have a set already. While holding them, stand in front of the pumpkin and: PC/Mac: Right-click Xbox: Hit LT PlayStation: Hit L2 Nintendo Switch: Hit ZL Mobile: Tap the pumpkin

steps.title: Make a jack-o-lantern.
steps.content: Make a jack-o-lantern. Place the carved pumpkin in the center slot of the crafting table. Then, place a torch in the slot beneath the pumpkin to create a jack-o-lantern. [2] X Research source Jack-o-lanterns can be used as a light source in the game.

steps.title: Wear it as a helmet.
steps.content: Wear it as a helmet. Place the carved pumpkin in the helmet slot of your character’s armor. Wearing a pumpkin helmet reduces your visibility, but it does allow you to observe Enderman without being attacked. [3] X Research source Open up your inventory to access your character’s armor slots.

steps.title: Create an iron golem or snow golem.
steps.content: Create an iron golem or snow golem. Carved pumpkins act as the “head” for iron golems and snow golems that you make on your own. To make an iron golem : Make 4 iron blocks and stack them in a capital “T” shape. Then, place a carved pumpkin or jack-o-lantern on top of the “T” to bring the golem to life. To make a snow golem : Stack 2 snow blocks on top of each other, placing a carved pumpkin or jack-o-lantern on top to animate the snow golem.
